statement.p: Let P be a stochastic n \times n matrix with positive entries. Give two methods of finding the steady state solution and discuss their computational efficiency. Give an example when P is stochastic, and does not have positive entries, but the steady state does not exist.
Let A be a positive stochastic matrix with steady state w=\vec{1/3 2/3}. What does A^n \vec{9 0} converge to as n \to \infty?
